subject: Re: Re: SIMSONN CANBus Protocol
description_text:

wrote:

> On Tue, Apr 8, 2025 at 12:03 PM General and sales enquiries <
> service@simsonn.com> wrote:
>
>> Hi,
>> We haven't started this part of the code yet, we just reserved space, so
>> we don't have any data yet
>> ------------------------------
>> service@simsonn.com
>>
>>
>> *From:* AirFlex Suspension <contact@airflx.com.au>
>> *Date:* 2025-04-08 08:51
>> *To:* General and sales enquiries <service@simsonn.com>
>> *Subject:* Re: Re: SIMSONN CANBus Protocol
>> Thanks, there is no data on these pins. we should use 500KB bitrate,
>> 0x197 byte 2, 0x5E as shift down, 0x6E as shift up
>> 0x202 can include backlight level data (0x00-0xFF)
>> 0x3FD byte 2, 0x20 should be S1 button, 0x80 should be S2 button
>>
>> Warm and Kind Regards,
>>
>> *Pravin Bajwa*
>> DIRECTOR / TECHNICAL
>>
>>
>> *@airflx <https://www.instagram.com/airflx/>*
>> *02 7255 5152*
>> *www.airflx.com.au <http://www.airflx.com.au/>*
>>
>>

>>>> *Subject:* Re: Re: SIMSONN CANBus Protocol
>>>> We are using multiple devices - installation in over 100 cars, we

>>>> Warm and Kind Regards,
>>>>

>>>> DIRECTOR / TECHNICAL
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> *@airflx <https://www.instagram.com/airflx/>*
>>>> *02 7255 5152*
>>>> *www.airflx.com.au <http://www.airflx.com.au/>*

>>>>>> Hello there,
>>>>>>
>>>>>> We recently purchased some SQ Pro shifters to use in real cars for
>>>>>> sequential shifter actuation and we are integrating them to use with our
>>>>>> engine management system
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I understand your peripherals use CAN protocol in the transmit port
>>>>>> over RJ45, could you let us know the frames and data information so we can
>>>>>> integrate it?
>>>>>>
>>>>>> *Warm and Kind Regards, *

conversations.body_text: Hi AirFlex Suspension,  Not at the moment, as this was specifically designed for our own base. Given the relatively small demand, we haven’t initiated development for this yet.
Does it work with the base? If so then the CANBUS is functional, I just need to know the addresses Warm and Kind Regards, - Pravin Bajwa DIRECTOR / TECHNICAL @airflx www.airflx.com.au

Can you please tell me the CANBUS bitrate and addresses for the base?

Warm and Kind Regards,

*Pravin Bajwa*
DIRECTOR / TECHNICAL


*@airflx <https://www.instagram.com/airflx/>*
*02 7255 5152*
*www.airflx.com.au <http://www.airflx.com.au/>*

On Wed, Jul 16, 2025 at 4:05 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi AirFlex Suspension,  This interface was specifically designed for our own wheelbase and is not currently open for external use. Developing a standalone version for other devices would require significant time for development and testing, and we hope for your understanding. However, if you have a bulk customization request, we can initiate a dedicated project and assign developers to support and maintain the code accordingly.

We already have purchased bulk units. We are not asking for any thing in
specific or any custom work. Simply the CAN speed and data format.

Warm and Kind Regards,

*Pravin Bajwa*
DIRECTOR / TECHNICAL


*@airflx <https://www.instagram.com/airflx/>*
*02 7255 5152*
*www.airflx.com.au <http://www.airflx.com.au/>*


On Wed, Jul 16, 2025 at 8:10 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi AirFlex Suspension,  May I ask which platform you placed your bulk order on? Please provide the order number so I can follow up with the relevant team for assistance.

Please either provide a refund or provide the information requested. Your
product was advertised with CANBUS compatibility - we just need to know the
information of compatibility so we can make our host device communicate
with it

Warm and Kind Regards,

*Pravin Bajwa*
DIRECTOR / TECHNICAL


*@airflx <https://www.instagram.com/airflx/>*
*02 7255 5152*
*www.airflx.com.au <http://www.airflx.com.au/>*


On Thu, Jul 17, 2025 at 11:53 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi AirFlex Suspension,  We have not promoted the CAN BUS feature, as it is reserved for our future proprietary wheelbase and has not yet been upgraded. Therefore, we are unable to provide software support for this interface at the moment. As a simulator user, this will not affect your normal usage, but we currently do not support secondary development.
